title: Synthetic Recap
body:
TORONTO (AP) — In the quiet, cavernous halls of a visiting arena, Reggie Miller authored a masterpiece. On a night where offensive flow was a precious commodity, Miller was a torrent of fire and skill, pouring in a career-high and franchise-record 42 points to single-handedly will the Indiana Pacers to a 100-89 victory over the Toronto Raptors.

From the opening tip, this was a Miller clinic. While his teammates combined for a paltry 58 points, Miller was a study in offensive relentlessness. The Raptors had no answer. He danced through screens, drained impossible jumpers, and carved his way to the rim with a scorer’s cold-blooded intent. His performance was not just prolific; it was historic, etching his name alone atop the Pacers' record books.

The game was a defensive grind, but Miller was the unstoppable force. He shouldered the entire offensive load, providing the Pacers with the necessary firepower to slowly dismantle the Raptors. Every time Toronto threatened to close the gap, there was Miller, silencing the crowd with another dagger.

He didn't just score; he dominated, adding 7 rebounds to his legendary scoring outburst. This wasn't a mere win on the schedule. This was a coronation. In a virtuoso performance for the ages, Reggie Miller didn't just beat the Raptors; he transcended the game itself, delivering a night that would be whispered about for decades.
